page.title: 13Heslington Tilmire
page.content: We wanted to discover what grasses, plants, shrubs and insects we could find on Heslington Tilmire, an area of rough grazing containing wide fingers of marshy land. We walked to the Tilmire along the outgang, a rough track. The Tilmire was enclosed in 1760. The outgang was made in 1762 to provide access for the Tilmire freeholders. To our left was a tall hedgerow containing Hawthorne, Alder, Beech, Oak and Willow. The hedgerow is about three hundred years old. In the grasses at the bottom of the hedgerow we found Hogweed, Cuckoopint, Woundwort or Hedgenettle and Eyebright. We decided to set up three thirty metre line transects to provide a comparison. We set them up at the southern edge of Fulford Heath Golf course,at the Southern and Northern edge of the Tilmire
